trans-unit.source:
\n

Supports the use of non-ASCII characters for Internet domain names.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx xxx xxx xx xxx$XXXXX xxxxxxxxxx xxx Xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
This class cannot be inherited.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if unassigned code points are used in operations; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: true if standard naming conventions are used in operations; otherwise, false.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxxxx xxx xxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxx$ $xxxxxx$xxxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The object to compare to the current object.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Encodes a string of domain name labels that consist of Unicode characters to a string of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The string is formatted according to the IDNA standard.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to convert, which consists of one or more domain name labels delimited with label separators.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The equivalent of the string specified by the unicode parameter, consisting of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) and formatted according to the IDNA standard.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: unicode is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Encodes a substring of domain name labels that include Unicode characters outside the US-ASCII character range.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The substring is converted to a string of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range and is formatted according to the IDNA standard.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to convert, which consists of one or more domain name labels delimited with label separators.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A zero-based offset into unicode that specifies the start of the substring to convert.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx$xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The conversion operation continues to the end of the unicode string.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The equivalent of the substring specified by the unicode and index parameters, consisting of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) and formatted according to the IDNA standard.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: unicode is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
index is less than zero.

-or-

index is greater than the length of unicode.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Encodes the specified number of characters in a substring of domain name labels that include Unicode characters outside the US-ASCII character range.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx.

trans-unit.source: The substring is converted to a string of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range and is formatted according to the IDNA standard.
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx xxx xx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to convert, which consists of one or more domain name labels delimited with label separators.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

A zero-based offset into unicode that specifies the start of the substring.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx$xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of characters to convert in the substring that starts at the position specified by index in the unicode string.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The equivalent of the substring specified by the unicode, index, and count parameters, consisting of displayable Unicode characters in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) and formatted according to the IDNA standard.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$$ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx$ xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: unicode is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
index or count is less than zero.

-or-

index is greater than the length of unicode.

-or-

index is greater than the length of unicode minus count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxxxx$$xx$ xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Decodes a string of one or more domain name labels, encoded according to the IDNA standard, to a string of Unicode characters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx$ xx x xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to decode, which consists of one or more labels in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) encoded according to the IDNA standard.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The Unicode equivalent of the IDNA substring specified by the ascii parameter.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: ascii is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Decodes a substring of one or more domain name labels, encoded according to the IDNA standard, to a string of Unicode characters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx$ xx x xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to decode, which consists of one or more labels in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) encoded according to the IDNA standard.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

A zero-based offset into ascii that specifies the start of the substring to decode.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx$xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
The decoding operation continues to the end of the ascii string.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The Unicode equivalent of the IDNA substring specified by the ascii and index parameters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: ascii is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
index is less than zero.

-or-

index is greater than the length of ascii.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

Decodes a substring of a specified length that contains one or more domain name labels, encoded according to the IDNA standard, to a string of Unicode characters.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxx xx x xxxxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxxx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx$ xx x xxxxxx xx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The string to decode, which consists of one or more labels in the US-ASCII character range (U+0020 to U+007E) encoded according to the IDNA standard.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxx$ xxxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxx xx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx XX$XXXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxx $X$0000 xx X$000X$ xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

A zero-based offset into ascii that specifies the start of the substring.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$X xxxx$xxxxx xxxxxx xxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxx xxxxxxxxx xxx xxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The number of characters to convert in the substring that starts at the position specified by index in the ascii string.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxxx xx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxxx xxxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

The Unicode equivalent of the IDNA substring specified by the ascii, index, and count parameters.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx Xxxxxxx xxxxxxxxxx xx xxx XXXX xxxxxxxxx xxxxxxxxx xx xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ $xx$xxxxx$$xx$$ xxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source: ascii is null.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx $xxxxxx$xxxx$$xxxxxx$.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
index or count is less than zero.

-or-

index is greater than the length of ascii.

-or-

index is greater than the length of ascii minus count.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxx xxxx xxxx.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x$x$$xx$$$x$$x$x$$x$xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xx xxxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxx xx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$ xxxxx $xx$xxxxx$$xx$.$$x$$x
